p: The ternary phase diagram of different formulations of SNEDDS, which was prepared by varying the concentration of Peceol ®, Kolliphor ® EL, and Transcutol ® P, is demonstrated in Figure 3. The ternary phase diagram was constructed based on solubility and emulsification studies to identify the nanoemulsifying region (Z-avg < 200 nm, T% > 90%), and the composition also helps to determine the concentration range of components for the formation of a nanoemulsion. Compositions containing more than 22% oil phase were found to be out of the nanoemulsifying region. It was observed that at least 40% surfactant is required for producing droplets under 200 nm.
